quī subdit populum meum sub mē. ^ My mercy
column8: and I have hoped in him
column9: who subdueth my people under me.

quī docet manūs meās ad praelium: quia innōtuistī eī? Aut fīlius hominis
that thou art made known to him? or the son of man
column6: that thou makest account of him?

1 ^ Benedictus Dominus Deus meus: 4 ^ Homō vānitātī similis factus est; diēs ejus sīcut umbra praeteriunt. ^ Man is like to vanity; his days pass away like a shadow.

who teacheth my hands to fight: bow down thy heavens and descend; touch the mountains

quī docet manūs meās ad praelium: et dissipābis eōs; ēmitte sagittās tuās
et digitōs meōs ad bellum. ^ Blessed be: et conturbābis eōs. ^ Send forth lightning
who teacheth my hands to fight: and thou shalt scatter them; shoot out thy arrows

et digitōs meōs ad bellum. ^ Blessed be: et līberā mē dē aquīs multīs
^ Put forth thy hand from on high
column7: and deliver me from many waters
column8: from the hand of strange children

quī docet manūs meās ad praelium: et dextera eōrum dextera inīquitātis. ^ whose mouth hath spoken vanity
et digitōs meōs ad bellum. ^ Blessed be: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity.

quī docet manūs meās ad praelium: canticum novum cantābō tibi; in psaltēriō
I will sing a new canticle; on the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises to thee.

quī docet manūs meās ad praelium: quī redēmistī Dāvid servum tuum dē gladiō malignō. ^ Who givest salvation to kings; who hast redeemed thy servant David from the malicious sword.
et ērue mē dē manū fīliōrum aliēnōrum
column6: and rescue me out of the hand of strange children
column8: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity

1 ^ Benedictus Dominus Deus meus: 12 ^ quōrum fīliī sīcut novellae plantātiōnēs in juventūte suā. Fīliae eōrum compositae; circumornātae ut similitūdō templī. ^ whose sons are as new plants in their youth. Their daughters decked out
quī docet manūs meās ad praelium: adorned round about after the similitude of a temple.
ēructantia ex hōc in illud. Ovēs eōrum foetōsae
et digitōs meōs ad bellum. ^ Blessed be: abundantēs in ēgressibus suīs. ^ Their storehouses full
who teacheth my hands to fight: flowing out of this into that. Their sheep fruitful in young

1 ^ Benedictus Dominus Deus meus: 14 ^ Bovēs eōrum crassae. Nōn est ruīna māceriae
et digitōs meōs ad bellum. ^ Blessed be: neque clāmor in platēīs eōrum. ^ Their oxen fat. There is no breach of wall
nor crying out in their streets.

quī docet manūs meās ad praelium: cuj haec sunt; beātus populus cujus Dominus Deus ejus. ^ They have called the people happy
et digitōs meōs ad bellum. ^ Blessed be: that hath these things; but happy is that people whose God is the Lord.
